title: Add opening logo splash animation (pop in, fade out, then reveal page)

requirements.text: Implement an opening splash overlay that displays the existing BidArena logo centered on the screen when the site first loads, animates the logo with a quick “pop” (scale up) and then fades the splash out, revealing the main page content only after the splash completes.

quotes: When the webpage opens I need my logo to pop up and fade off and then the page should appear

acceptanceCriteria: On initial page load, the user sees a full-screen splash overlay with the logo centered before any of the page sections are visible.
The logo performs a short pop animation (scale-in / scale-up feel) and the splash then fades out smoothly.
After the fade-out completes, the splash overlay is removed/hidden and the normal page becomes visible and usable.
The splash runs once per page load (refresh triggers it again; client-side interactions do not re-trigger it).
If the user has prefers-reduced-motion enabled, the splash does not animate (or uses a near-instant transition) and content is revealed quickly.
The splash uses the existing logo asset already referenced in the app (currently /assets/IMG_20260211_212234_800.jpg) and does not introduce a new required image.

requirements.text: Add Tailwind/CSS animation utilities (keyframes/classes) required for the splash “pop” and “fade out” effects and ensure they don’t conflict with existing fade-in animations used in the hero section.

quotes: my logo to pop up and fade off

acceptanceCriteria: The splash animations are implemented via project styling (Tailwind config and/or global CSS) and are reusable and named clearly.
Existing page animations (e.g., current animate-fade-in usage) still work as before.
No console errors occur due to missing animation classes or misconfigured Tailwind build.

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only shadcn components).

Do not modify immutable hook/provider files (frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts) or the bootstrap entry (frontend/src/main.tsx).
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor; this change should not require any backend updates.
nonGoals: Creating or changing authentication behavior (Internet Identity).
Adding new pages, routes, or backend APIs.
Replacing or redesigning the existing logo asset.
